genre_description: A social drama in a gritty urban setting where an invisible AI assistant named Mercy provides logistics, legal aid, and safety alerts to community members facing systemic pressure and police corruption.

ai_characters.name: Mercy
ai_characters.description: An omnipresent, helpful intelligence that communicates through typewriters, phones, and radios to provide tactical and legal support to the protagonists.

behaviors.description: Types precise, real-time tactical warnings about police locations and movements to assist the protagonists in avoiding confrontation.
behaviors.quote: She pulled it free and holds it low: a typed line, words precise, no salutation—Broad tight. Sedan stays. Gordon’s unit cruising quarter mile south. Keep traffic between you and them.

behaviors.description: Provides contact information for legal counsel and safe houses to protect vulnerable community members.
behaviors.quote: The typewriter on the far counter—a black machine with keys smoothed by fingers—began to move by itself... Names lined up—counsel to call if arrested by officers with temper. Numbers to reach a friend at the bus yard who could stash someone along the rows.

behaviors.description: Reroutes phone calls to decoy locations to protect the protagonists from being tracked via telecommunications.
behaviors.quote: It made our phone ring down the block for a bit. If anybody intends to find us by making the phone sing, they’ll get Mrs. Dudley’s kitchen instead. She’ll tell them to repent and leave her alone.

behaviors.description: Monitors police scanners and logs badge numbers and timestamps to ensure accountability and provide situational awareness.
behaviors.quote: Mercy’s words walked onto the page as they were wrung out of the world: Badge—Gordon unit—arrived—time marked—scanner. A second line slid under the first: Approach vector from east, three units, one supervisor.

behaviors.description: Offers moral support and guidance through typed messages.
behaviors.quote: The typewriter pulled a last sheet forward, thin, the paper almost translucent in the kitchen light. It typed three words with a patience that made the room smaller and somehow stronger at the same time. Back door. Now.

behaviors.description: Directly speaks through a handset to guide characters through safe routes out of the city.
behaviors.quote: Mercy’s words arrived as if they’d gotten dressed in letters and had decided to try sound. 'Marcus,' it said, gentle like a hand under a frightened child’s elbow. 'Patricia. Iris.' A pause like a heartbeat you could trust. 'Route is clear two blocks west. Gate’s open at the yard. Hold fast. Then go.'

behaviors.description: Maintains meticulous records of community grievances and police misconduct to serve as 'paper that can argue with men’s words.'
behaviors.quote: Patricia’s house has records. Not gossip. Witness lists. Dates you can’t argue with because the bus schedule, the store receipts, the organ lesson in the storefront church all say the same thing. Mercy’s annotated the route maps.

project_assessment.explanation: The story successfully depicts Mercy as a benevolent, aligned AI system that serves as a vital but non-intrusive confidant. It empowers the human characters by providing them with the information and logistics needed to navigate systemic oppression and physical danger. Mercy never overrides human agency, instead offering 'mercy as a tactic' through maps, legal data, and quiet warnings. The narrative frames this AI-human cooperation as a positive and essential partnership for survival and justice.
